title: Magnetic flux - flux from changing B field

content.question: Which graph correctly represents the magnetic flux <math alttext="phi" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Î¦</mi> </math> through the loop as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a 4 by 6 gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the values the fraction pi over 2 omega, the fraction pi over omega, and the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega are indicated 1, 2, and 3 units respectively to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled phi, and the value B sub 0, end subscript, A, is indicated 2 units above the origin. The wave begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right to reach a peak at the point with coordinates the fraction pi over 2 omega comma B sub 0, end subscript, A. It crosses the horizontal axis at the fraction pi over omega. It reaches its trough 2 units below the horizontal axis at the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega. The wave ends on the horizontal axis 4 units to the right of the origin.

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a 4 by 6 gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the values the fraction pi omega over 2, pi omega, and the fraction 3 pi omega over 2 are indicated 1, 2, and 3 units respectively to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled phi, and the value B sub 0, end subscript, A, is indicated 2 units above the origin. The wave begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right to reach a peak at the point with coordinates the fraction pi omega over 2 comma B sub 0, end subscript, A. It crosses the horizontal axis at pi omega. It reaches its trough 2 units below the horizontal axis at the fraction 3 pi omega over 2. The wave ends on the horizontal axis 4 units to the right of the origin.

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a 4 by 6 gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the values the fraction pi over 2 omega, the fraction pi over omega, and the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega are indicated 1, 2, and 3 units respectively to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled phi, and the value B sub 0, end subscript, A, is indicated 2 units above the origin. The wave begins at B sub 0, end subscript, A, and moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at the fraction pi over 2 omega, and reaches a trough 2 units below the horizontal axis at the fraction pi over omega. It then moves back upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis again at the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega, and ends above the horizontal axis 4 units to the right of the origin and at height B sub 0, end subscript, A.

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a 4 by 6 gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the values the fraction pi omega over 2, pi omega, and the fraction 3 pi omega over 2 are indicated 1, 2, and 3 units respectively to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled phi, and the value B sub 0, end subscript, A, is indicated 2 units above the origin. The wave begins at B sub 0, end subscript, A, and moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at the fraction pi omega over 2, and reaches a trough 2 units below the horizontal axis the fraction pi omega. It then moves back upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis again at the fraction 3 pi omega over 2, and ends above the horizontal axis 4 units to the right of the origin and at height B sub 0, end subscript, A.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a 4 by 6 gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the values the fraction pi over 2 omega, the fraction pi over omega, and the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega are indicated 1, 2, and 3 units respectively to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled phi, and the value B sub 0, end subscript, A, is indicated 2 units above the origin. The wave begins at B sub 0, end subscript, A, and moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at the fraction pi over 2 omega, and reaches a trough 2 units below the horizontal axis at the fraction pi over omega. It then moves back upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis again at the fraction 3 pi over 2 omega, and ends above the horizontal axis 4 units to the right of the origin and at height B sub 0, end subscript, A.
